alert.note: Alert for Laurel; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 12:28PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne, southwestern Laurel, southeastern Pulaski and north central McCreary Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1228 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Frazer, or 9 miles south of Somerset, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Quinton around 1235 PM EDT. Bronston around 1240 PM EDT. Burnside, Tateville and General Burnside S.P. around 1245 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Somerset, Elihu, Sloans Valley, Alpine, Ruth, Mount Victory, Dykes, Grade and Huxley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
